body.p:
Bardstown Ky
June 8th 1864.
His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette
Govr State Ky,
Govenor.
I have the honor to enclose a letter from Col Wolford.
I saw him on Monday, and he was pleased to say, that he would be glad if you would at once issue my commission
He requested me to say to you, that it would be necessary to have a mustering officer at Lebanon by the 19th inst -- as the Companies would be on the ground by that time.
He is confident that he will have more than enough to fill his Regiment.

I have the honor to be your most obt servt.
Al. D. Hynes.

A. D Hynes Adjt
1 Regt Capitol Guard
May 15. 1864

Bardstown Ky
June 8th 1864
1 Regt Capitol Guard
Co. B
4th Cavalry
Hynes Al. D
To the Governor inclosing note from Col Wolford recommending him for Adjt of his regiment. Will need a mustering officer at Lebanon by the 19th.
Issue commission as Adjt. This regiment will be mustered into the state service only and be held for capital defence

Com issd & fowd
June 157 1864
Recd A G O. 15 June 1864
